thread.title: Selfie-crazed teens keep falling through frozen Central Park pond
thread.title_full: Selfie-crazed teens keep falling through frozen Central Park pond | New York Post

author: Caroll Alvarado
title: Selfie-crazed teens keep falling through frozen Central Park pond
text:
Another group of kids attempting to take a selfie on top of some ice at The Pond in Central Park plunged into its icy waters, officials said.
Two teenage boys, ages 15 and 13, were attempting to take a selfie on top of the frozen body of water when they fell through the ice at around 7 p.m. Sunday.
Luckily, they were able to swim ashore and then walked away from the scene, multiple witnesses told the NYPD.
Authorities later caught up with the two kids around the parkâ€™s 60th Street exit near Sixth Avenue. The teenagers had no visible signs of injuries, but were taken to St. Lukes Hospital for observation, officials said.
Last month, at least seven teenage boys fell through The Pond while attempting to take a group selfie on top of the thinly frozen surface.
They had to be rescued by Good Samaritans and firefighters.
